metadata.title: How to Create YouTube Playlists 2025: Organize Videos for Growth
metadata.description: Create and optimize YouTube playlists. Increase watch time and organization.

hero.headline: How to Create YouTube Playlists
hero.subheadline: Organize content. Boost watch time. Help viewers binge.

sections.content: Playlists organize your content and encourage binge-watching by auto-playing the next video. They appear in search results, can rank independently, and significantly boost session watch time. Strategic playlist creation is an underutilized growth lever.

sections.title: Creating a Playlist
content: Go to YouTube Studio or youtube.com

sections.title: Playlist Optimization Tips
content: Add new videos to relevant playlists

faq.question: How many playlists should I have?
faq.answer: At least one for every topic/series you cover. More is fine—help viewers find specific content. 10-30 playlists common for established channels. Quality over quantity—each should have purpose.

faq.question: Do playlists help with SEO?
faq.answer: Yes—playlists can rank in YouTube and Google search. Titles and descriptions indexed. Watch time from playlists signals value. Cross-link between related playlists for internal SEO.

faq.question: Best video order in playlists?
faq.answer: Put most engaging/popular video first to hook viewers. Then logical progression. For series, chronological order. For topics, most helpful content first. Test different orders.

faq.question: Can I add other creators' videos?
faq.answer: Yes—you can add any public video to your playlists. Good for curating helpful content for your audience. Be careful not to send viewers away from your content. Most creators stick to their own videos.
